intro: Erodium malacoides var. ribifolium, commonly known as the redstem stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate and have a serrated margin, while the fruits are small, three-lobed capsules. This species is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
